short-container-title: Acta Cryst Sect E Cryst Commun
items.abstract: <jats:p>A new polymorph of the title compound, [Re(NCS)(C<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>8</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O)(CO)<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>], crystallizing in the space group<jats:italic>P</jats:italic>2<jats:sub>1</jats:sub>/<jats:italic>n</jats:italic>, has been obtained and structurally characterized by the experiment and DFT calculations. In this complex, the rhenium(I) cation is octahedrally coordinated by three carbonyl groups in a facial configuration, the<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>,<jats:italic>O</jats:italic>-bidentate<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>-methylpyridine-2-carboxamide ligand and the<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>-bonded thiocyanate anion. Neighbouring molecules are linked into a three-dimensional network by intermolecular N—H...S and C—H...S interactions.</jats:p>
title: Crystal structure of a second polymorph of tricarbonyl(N-methylpyridine-2-carboxamide-κ2N1,O)(thiocyanato-κN)rhenium(I)

short-container-title: Acta Cryst Sect E Cryst Commun
items.abstract: <jats:p>The structure of the title compound, [Al<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>(OH)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>(C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>12</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O)<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>]I<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>·4C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>12</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O (systematic name: di-μ<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-hydroxido-bis{tris[1,3-dimethyltetrahydropyrimidin-2(1<jats:italic>H</jats:italic>)-one-κ<jats:italic>O</jats:italic>]aluminium} tetraiodide 1,3-dimethyltetrahydropyrimidin-2(1<jats:italic>H</jats:italic>)-one tetrasolvate), is composed of two Al(C<jats:sub>6</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>12</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O)<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>moieties linked into a centrosymmetric dinuclear unit by a pair of bridging hydroxide ions. The aluminium cations show a distorted trigonal bipyramidal AlO<jats:sub>5</jats:sub>coordination environment formed only by monodentate ligands. The Al—O bond lengths are in the range 1.789 (2)–1.859 (2) Å (mean bond length = 1.818 Å). The non-coordinating iodide anions compensate the charge of the complex cation. The remaining solvent molecules and the iodide counter-anions interact with the complex cation by weak non-classical C—H...I and C—H...O hydrogen bonds.</jats:p>
title: Crystal structure of hexakis(dmpu)-di-μ2-hydroxido-dialuminium tetraiodide dmpu tetrasolvate [dmpu is 1,3-dimethyltetrahydropyrimidin-2(1H)-one]: a centrosymmetric dinuclear aluminium complex containing AlO5polyhedra

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
				<jats:p> The crystal structure of new conformation of the CyMe<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>-BTBP ligand (ttc) has been presented. The ttt conformer of this compound in a form of THF solvate has been also crystallized. The geometries of six possible conformations (ttt, ttc, tct, tcc, ctc and ccc) of the CyMe<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>-BTBP ligand have been modeled in the gas phase and in solutions (MeOH and H<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O) by DFT calculations using B3LYP/6-31G(d,p) method. According to the calculations, in the three different media the conformers with trans orientation of the N atoms in the bipyridyl moiety are the most stable.</jats:p>
title: Crystal structures and conformers of CyMe4-BTBP
